USA Cost/Aid Facts. The cost of the study per year (Tuition and fees, does not include living expenses) in USA varies from $5000 to $50000 (might be much more too for MBA/Medical or other programs) per year. The cost of living depends on the location. Several LPN programs are available in every state with tuition ranging from $1,000 to $15,000 depending on the program. Although some program options are noteworthy, not all meet the criteria for approval by your state's Board of Nursing, the governmental agency that regulates nursing and determines license eligibility. Programs vary in the types of fees, but expect to pay several of the following: 1  Application Fee: $20-$50. 2  Admission Exam Fee: $20-$60. 3  Course registration: $15-$30. 4  Lab: $20-$50.

Tuition and Fees. Tuition Effective for students that enroll on or after December 15, 2014 for new and re-entering students starting on or after January 5, 2015. United States University Board of Trustees reserves the right to modify tuition at any time. Students will be notified at least 30 days in advance

The Office of Student Accounting is located in Meisler Hall, Suite 1300, and provides a variety of financial services to students. The office is responsible for implementing tuition and fee policies approved by the University Board of Trustees.
